means: 保证（做某事、遵守协议或遵从安排等）

sentence.Network_en: He should not commit American troops without the full consent of Congress.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有国会的完全同意，他不应该调遣美国军队。

sentence.Network_en: She didn't want to commit herself one way or the other.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管怎样，她都不想明确表态。

sentence.Network_en: It makes me sick that people commit offences and never get punished.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些人屡屡犯罪却从未受到惩戒，这真让我气愤。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 被提交(commit)之前, permissions没有被初始化,那么这个集合将永远不能载入他的数据了。 解决方法是把读取集合数据的语句提到Ses…
Oracle Flashback技术总结 - 田园居 - 博客园 ... > delete from A; 已删除4行。 > commit; 提交完成。 > COMMIT; 提交完成。.
大英语B级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... commission n. 委任,委托 commit vt. 做,犯(错误),处理,保证 commitment n. 委托,许诺,承担.
大学英语四级考试大纲 - 豆丁网 ... commission n. 委任状；委员会 commit vt. 犯(错误);干(坏事) committee n. 委员会；全体委员.

list.abs: 阀门优秀制造商-江苏诚一阀门有限公司 ... 特殊阀门 Special Valve 服务承诺 Service commitment 订购须知 Ordering.
组织承诺(organizational commitment)也有译为“组织归属感”、“组织忠诚”等。组织承诺一般是指个体认同并参与一个组织的强度。
TOEFL词频表 - 豆丁网 ... commit crime 犯罪 commit suicide 自杀 commod 方便.
求英语六级高级... ... 17．做出共同努力 make joint efforts 19．致力于/ 投身于 be committed 20．不可推卸的义务 unshakable duty.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin committere 'join, entrust' (in medieval Latin 'put into custody'), from com- 'with' + mittere 'put or send'

entry.def: If someone commits a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad.

example.ex: I have never committed any crime...
This is a man who has committed murder.

entry.def: If someone commits suicide, they deliberately kill themselves.

example.ex: There are unconfirmed reports he tried to commit suicide.
example.tran: 有未经证实的报道说他曾企图自杀。

entry.def: If you commit money or resources to something, you decide to use them for a particular purpose.

example.ex: They called on Western nations to commit more money to the poorest nations...
example.tran: 他们呼吁西方国家向极端贫困国家投入更多的钱。

example.ex: The government had committed billions of pounds for a programme to reduce acid rain...
example.tran: 政府已经给一个旨在减少酸雨的方案拨了几十亿英镑。

entry.def: If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.

example.ex: I would advise people to think very carefully about committing themselves to working Sundays...
example.tran: 我建议大家慎重考虑一下答应周日工作的问题。

example.ex: I'd like a friendship that might lead to something deeper, but I wouldn't want to commit myself too soon...
example.tran: 我希望拥有一份能进一步发展的友谊，但又不想太快作出承诺。

entry.def: If you do not want to commit yourself on something, you do not want to say what you really think about it or what you are going to do.

example.ex: It isn't their diplomatic style to commit themselves on such a delicate issue...
example.tran: 对这样一个微妙的问题明确表态并非他们的外交风格。

example.ex: She didn't want to commit herself one way or the other.
example.tran: 不管怎样，她都不想明确表态。

entry.tran: 把…正式送进(医院、监狱等)
entry.def: If someone is committed to a hospital, prison, or other institution, they are officially sent there for a period of time.

example.ex: Arthur's drinking caused him to be committed to a psychiatric hospital.
example.tran: 阿瑟由于酗酒被送进一家精神病医院。

entry.def: In the British legal system, if someone is committed for trial, they are sent by magistrates to stand trial in a crown court.

example.ex: He is expected to be committed for trial at Liverpool Crown Court.
example.tran: 预计他会被移交利物浦高等刑事法庭。

entry.def: If you commit something to paper or to writing, you record it by writing it down. If you commit something to memory, you learn it so that you will remember it.

example.ex: She had not committed anything to paper about it...
example.tran: 关于这件事她未曾写下只言片语。

example.ex: I'll repeat that so you can commit it to memory.
example.tran: 我会重复一下，好让你们记住。

means.word_mean: 1. perform an act, usually with a negative connotation;
2. give entirely to a specific person, activity, or cause;

sentences.sentence: "She committed herself to the work of God"
"give one's talents to a good cause"

means.word_mean: 3. cause to be admitted; of persons to an institution;

sentences.sentence: "After the second episode, she had to be committed"
"The messenger was entrusted with the general's secret"

auth_sentence.content: The appointee will be expected to commit to teaching.
auth_sentence.res_content: The appointee will be expected to commit to teaching.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The appointee will be expected to commit to teaching.

auth_sentence.content: The enormity of the crime he wanted to commit.
auth_sentence.res_content: The enormity of the crime he wanted to commit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The enormity of the crime he wanted to commit.

auth_sentence.content: To do other wise will be to commit suicide.
auth_sentence.res_content: To do other wise will be to commit suicide.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To do other wise will be to commit suicide.

stems_affixes.word_buile: intermit[v.中断]+t+ent……的→adj.间歇的,断断续续的
per始终+mit送,放出,派,错过→始终放出→许可

stems_affixes.value_cn: 承认,供认;准许……进入,准许……加入
把……交托给,委托,委任;提交;犯[错误],干[坏事]
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+mit送,放出,派,错过→共同送→委托

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发出;放射;吐露;散发;发表;发行
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+mit送,放出,派,错过→送出[气味]等
inter在……中间+mit送,放出,派,错过→在中间送东西→打断,间断
sub在下面+mit送,放出,派,错过→放下面→屈服
per始终+mit送,放出,派,错过→始终放出→许可
re再次+mit送,放出,派,错过→再次放出,送[钱]→宽恕,汇款

Sentence.sentence: He's about to commit suicide when he's interrupted by an old man who says his name is Smith.
it is committed with good intentions
Violation of a rule is misconduct even ifit is committed with good intentions?
But most woman are not committed careerists.
The court eventually freed Jackson after the police found the man who had really committed the crimes.

sentences.en: He has committed a serious fault.

means.word_mean: 承诺; 使自己受约束

sentences.en: Asked if he was a candidate, he refused to commit himself.
sentences.cn: 当问到他是不是候选人时, 他不置可否。

sentences.en: He has committed himself to support them.
sentences.cn: 他答应负担他们的生活。

sentences.en: The boy was committed to the care of his aunt.
sentences.cn: 这个孩子被交给他的姑妈照顾。

means.word_mean: 监禁，把…交付看管；下狱；判处(徒刑等)

sentences.en: The judge committed him to prison.

means.word_mean: 使承担义务；使做出保证；许诺

sentences.en: Don't commit your promises to paper if you are not certain you keep them.
sentences.cn: 如果你没有把握兑现你的许诺，你就不要做出书面保证。

means.word_mean: 指定…用于；调拨，调配…供使用

sentences.en: They committed more than three divisions to the operations.
sentences.cn: 他们调了三个多师参加这次战役。

jushi.english: He committed the crime under the influence of drink.
jushi.chinese: 他在醉酒状态中犯了罪。

jushi.english: I have committed myself, and there is no way to draw back.
jushi.chinese: 我既然已做了保证,就无法收回。

jushi.english: He has committed a serious fault.
